detailsOfAchievement: Haringhata Saphalya Development Society registered as a Society (NGO) under West Bengal Society Registration Act 1961. Established in West Bengal 2009, H.S.D.S was pioneered by a group of young professionals, all of whom were inspired by the conviction that individuals with knowledge resources and empathy for the marginalized must work with communities at the grassroots in order to help them overcome poverty. Haringhata Saphalya Development Society is a Non-govt. Social Service Organization working in the field of Rural Development for the poor people. Community development and also poverty alleviation is the main focus of the organization. H.S.D.S. is a multi service NGO having under taken interventions in the field of primary health care, education, child right, mother & child health care, control of blindness. Although H.S.D.S. is basically based on the main principle of causing socio-economic empowerment of the poor.

detailsOfAchievement: Adhiti means â€˜Adhyankariâ€™ (The Learners) in Bengali. Few learners from different colleges in Kolkata have assembled in a small place of Kalighat, South Kolkata, for practicing reading poems, stories, plays of different writers in Bengali literature in the year of 1998. At the same time the members have planned to favour the slum children residing in the adjacent area of Kalighat. The junior members were helped by their seniors in developing their school studies and sometimes all the members practiced rhymes, poems and the story telling together during the recess. Eminent performers from different cultural fields were glad to receive the invitation from the members of Adhiti and were interested enough to enrich the group. Some of the senior members have joined in the departments of Drama and Dance at Rabindra Bharati University, Kolkata, in order to enhance their knowledge. Adhiti began to steadily emphasize on story telling, after witnessing the performance of â€˜Kahani ki Manchanâ€™ by the Repertory Company of National School of Drama under the direction of Debendraraj Ankur, ex Director of the school in the National Theatre Festival organized by Nandikar,Kolkata. Later Adhiti organized performances on rhymes, story telling and play reading at the auditoriums in Kolkata regularly. The members of the group enriched themselves by observing the presentations of the eminent performers like Praidp Ghosh, Partha Ghosh, Saoli Mitra and others. Singers like Smt. Suchitra Mitra, Gita Ghatak, Arghya Sen have also participated in our programs. Members have improved themselves through these performances. Then Adhiti has received invitations for preparing productions for the children sections of Doordarshan Kendra, Kolkata. Adhiti is one of the primary groups in Kolkata to perform story telling or Galpoavinay in Bengali. Adhitis GalpoAvinay was and is still highly applauded not only in Kolkata but also in different districts of West Bengal. The group has received invitations from different Colleges, Universities and other Institutions during the hundred fiftieth birth anniversary of Rabindranath Thakur, to perform GalpoAvinay. At the same time, Adhiti is busy for the fortification and the development of the slum children with different activities. The members have performed the first full length theatre production, â€˜Mahajatra Botikaâ€™ based on a famous American Play, â€˜Arsenic and Old laceâ€™ by Joseph Kesselring. The play was highly applauded by the spectators of Kolkata and the Critics had appreciated even. The play was produced in the year of 2011 and ran more than two years. Then Adhiti has produced a compilation of short stories from Rabindranath Thakur, â€˜Ek Guccha Galpoâ€™, by name. The eminent artist Bijaylakshmi Burman( by invitation) , along with two other senior popular actors, Debashis Roychowdhury and Arunita Roychowdhury (from the Group) have performed the play. Now Adhiti is preparing the play â€˜Rakta Pushpaâ€™, written by the famous playwright, Mahesh Elkunchwar. The playâ€™s English adaptation, â€˜Flower of Bloodâ€™, was translated by Sarmila Moitra. Apart from the cultural activities Adhiti is always interested to serve for the betterment of the people and the society.

detailsOfAchievement: 26. In an Endeavour to secure the life of the poor and deprived people and to give them a sense of financial security , LIC ( Life Insurance Corporation of India) had launched a Special policy named â€œJivanmadhurâ€ and had provided our NGO the opportunity to serve the people. According to this policy any person with low income can also open a policy in his or her name with a nominal amount of INR 100/-per month. The policy allows the person to get the entire deposited amount along with the interest after the tenure is completed. And if the person meets accidental death, the nominee would be given an appropriate sum of money without interest within 7days. We are glad to announce that around 2,000 people living in various parts of Kolkata and North 24 Parganas have joined under these Scheme and we are still working in areas of South 24 Parganas , East Medinipur, West Medinipur and Burdwan. We are imparting Free Formal Education along with singing and drawing courses to the BPL Children Under this project we have been able to benefit around 320 BPL Children. With help of â€˜New Barrackpore Basti Unnoyon Samitiâ€™ andâ€™ Baguiati Sanskritrikâ€™ Forum we have been able to run school in rail basti and also in Different wards of Rajarhat Municipality and Bira municipality Rail Basti has also become a part of our educational project.. And we are glad to announce that in this course we have been able to establish 10 schools related to singing â€“dancing & drawing and heading towards a new and better India. We have been organizing various tree plantation campaigns in various parts of the city to help create a greener surrounding. We also distribute different variety of plants to the local people in the thickly populated area free of cost. We arrange workshop to guide the common mass from the ill effect of Arsenic polluted water and the ways to treat water. We also try to educate and encourage people for Terrace Water Harvesting during the monsoon. We have always been endorsing women independence, hence keeping that in mind we have built 13 self-dependent groups. 102 women after learning various courses like sewing, Stitching Boutique and Febric are leading a successful and self-dependent life. We have also been able to provide work to 35 jobless men through the courses of different Art & Craft. Who excel in making innovative and interesting show pieces and display them in different exhibitions and fair through permanent Stalls for Business.

detailsOfAchievement: 1. ICSP has achieved a unique distinction of becoming a SISTER ORGANIZATION of Calcutta University at par with Centrally funded organizations such as S.N. Bose Centre, Bose Institute, IACS, ISI, SINP, etc. in Kolkata region. 2. It has produced over 35 PhD students who received Degree from Calcutta and Jadavpur Universities. 3. It has participated in Major payload making projects and three of such payloads were flown to space by Russian satellite. 4. Its low cost Balloon borne program to do space based experiments at a height of 40 km is Internationally recognized. 5. Its has published hundreds of well cited papers in refereed journals. Three patents are pending. 6. State Government kept ICSP as a shortlisted Institutes of excellence who are funded with higher priority. 7. It has several permanent, semi- permanent and contractual staff members. 8. Its Midnapore campus (Ionospheric and Earthquake Research Centre) is being equipped with a 20" Optical Telescope, largest in the State and east India. 9. Its By-Pass campus, land of which was given by the State Government, is being built and the head quarter will be shifted there soon. 10. The payload X-ray Spectroscopy from Lunar Surface (XSLS) is being scheduled to be launched in 2017/2018 for science done from the Lunar Surface.

The project will be implemented in the states of Chhattisgarh under Baloda Bazar district and in Jharkhand state under Hazaribagh district for awareness creation, identify self initiated community organisers, preparation of community conservation plan, development of organic kitchen garden , production of organic inputs , sustainable harvesting of NTFPs and development of community resource persons and women empowerment.
Capacity building of the community for Participatory Biodiversity Conservation for improving natural capital and ecosystem services in West Bengal and Chhattisgarh

detailsOfAchievement: History, Mission and Vision IICPâ€™s mission is to work for equal rights and opportunities for persons with disabilities, particularly CP, and its vision is to facilitate an inclusive society Focus of IICPâ€™s work IICPâ€™s main focus is on the removal of barriers that prevent persons with CP and other neuro-motor disabilities from participating in all aspects of life and gaining access to human and constitutional rights. Growth, Current Programmes and Accomplishments Since 1974 IICP has pioneered services to cater to the needs of persons with cerebral palsy across all age groups. Starting with a special school for children with cerebral palsy in 1974 when there were none, IICP has pioneered the development of other complementary services, with a life cycle approach. Present Services Centre for Special Education for 165 children with CP, a NIOS offering Open Basic Education, secondary and senior secondary level courses. Early Intervention Clinic for babies under three years of age & Family Services for children aged 3 years +) with medical clinics, emphasizing advice and guidance for home management. Approximately 900 families a year are served through these services including around 225 families with children less than two years of age. Community Based Services Training courses at a degree and certificate level in collaboration with Jadavpur University and Rehabilitation Council of India Vocational Training Centre for adults with disability Adult Day Centre for adults with severe physical and complex communication impairments and those who have associated severe to profound intellectual disability (no upper age limit) Respite services for children (above 10 years of age) and adults with cerebral palsy (there is no upper age limit). ANKUR IICPâ€™s Advocacy Group for adults with disability was formed with the motto, â€˜Nothing about us without usâ€ and is committed to active participation in the disability rights movement. State Nodal Agency Centre (SNAC) of the National Trust Jugnu Sishu Vikas Kendra â€“ an afternoon playschool and nutrition programme for 75 children from nearby slums including 10 children with disability Roshni, National Resource Centre for Augmentative and Alternative Communication Information Communication Technology (ICT) for persons with complex communication needs Ongoing - Action research and assistive technology development Ongoing - All services include hydrotherapy, multi-sensory stimulation, physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy and social service support. Each service model including Community Services and the National Resource Centre for AAC is used for training and demonstration and has been successfully replicated - in essence and philosophy but with regional and environmental variations - in 16 organisations in 11 states. IICPâ€™s input to these affiliates is solely in training and capacity building. Awards Received 2004: Best Institute for Disability â€“ National Award from MSJE 2004: â€œOutstandingâ€ Training Centre â€“ Accreditation by RCI 2004: Best Respite Service â€“ National Trust 2004: State Award for Best Barrier free Environment 2006: Best SNAC â€“ National Trust 2009: Jeeja Ghosh and Saswati Acharya - Role Model Awards (PwD), State Welfare Department of WB 2010: Sudha Kaul, Vice Chair awarded the Padmashree 2011, 2012: Best Awareness Programme (Badhte Kadam) - National Trust (IICP as SNAC)

detailsOfAchievement: Indian Mime Theatre is a leading mime group in India working for the promotion, development and propagation of Bharatiya Mukabhinaya ( Indian Pantomime ) in India as well as abroad. It is founded by Shri Niranjan Goswami internationally known mime artiste and director in the year 1976 in Kolkata. Shri Goswami has been awarded Sangeet Natak Akademi award in 2002 & a recipient of Padma Shri award in 2009 and national and International awards. Indian Mime Theatre has different wings for different activities like Training & Workshop, Research & Documentation, Repertory, Festival, Children Theatre Workshop, Hridaya Akash - a welfare project for child development and Nakshigram - women and children development project. It is a registered society under the Society Registration Act of 1961. The organisation is registered under Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA). The organisation is eligible to provide tax exemption to its donors under section 80G of Income Tax Act. It is recognised by the Sangeet Natak Akademi (SNA), New Delhi; Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR), New Delhi; Paschim Banga Natya Akademi, Kolkata and Bharatiya Natya Sangha, New Delhi - the Indian chapter of International Theatre Institute, UNESCO, Paris, France. Indian Mime Theatre is empanelled with Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) to work as a cultural ambassador of India. Its activities under different wings includes Workshop in Mime, Acting, Puppet, Mask, Dance, Seminar, Exhibition, Lecture-Demonstration, Festival, Poster Design, Light Design, Costume Design, Set Design, Make-up, Effect Music, Magic, Mimicry, Vocational Training Programme for Youth, Projects for Special Children, Social Awareness Programme etc. Hriday Akash is an aspiring project of Indian Mime Theatre that presently deals with the children of slum areas and desire to establish a village where orphans & senior artistes will be provided accommodation with full facilities for education, cultural training and a platform to showcase their talents in different field of Art & Culture. Indian Mime Theatre has received a plot of land from Government of West Bengal at Salt Lake City, Kolkata and construction work is going on where it will be able to continue with its various activities and set up a National Mime Institute. It has visited abroad to perform in countries Like East and West Germany; USA; U.S.S.R.; England; France; Afghanistan etc. It also participated in International Festivals held in Pyong Yong in North Korea; Sanghai in China; Chuncheon in South Korea; Bogota & Medellin in Columbia etc. Different projects & activities that it has taken up so far as part of its socio-cultural & social welfare activities are : Mime training programme for the hearing challenge persons ; Culture and Values in Education through Performing & Allied Arts and Games; Non Formal Education through Performing & Allied Arts and Games; National Mime Festival for National Integration; National Cultural Camp for National Integration; Exhibition for Youth; Development of adlescent through Theatre; Vocational training for Youths; Vocational Training for Women; Vocational Training for children who left school; Developments of Adolescents & Girl Children through education, cultural therapy and computer training etc. Awareness programmes through street mime performances on Drug Abuses, Atrocities on women & girl children, AIDS, Literacy, Environment etc.
